clinical_study.brief_title: Benefits of Observing Point-light Displays in Postoperative Rehabilitation of the Total Knee Prosthesis.
clinical_study.official_title: Benefits of Observing Point-light Displays in Postoperative Rehabilitation of the Total Knee Prosthesis.

brief_summary.textblock: The LOARAL project concerns patients who have undergone total knee arthroplasty to treat symptomatic osteoarthritis. Patient will be divided into two groups: a control group where patients will do standard rehabilitation and an experimental group where patients will do standard rehabilitation associated with the judgement of point-light display. The aim of this study is to validate the use of point-light display for the Rehabilitation of patients with a totalarthroplasty of the knee.

primary_outcome.measure: Compare the evaluation of the point light display relative to conventional rehabilitation
primary_outcome.description: The time to realize the time up and go test will be assessed at inclusion and at the end of the program.

secondary_outcome.measure: Compare the evaluation of the point light display on functional recovery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the program (3 weeks max)
secondary_outcome.description: Test score the time up and go and test score questionnary WOMAC (Western Ontario and McMaster Universities Osteoarthritis Index, Bellamy et al., 1988).

secondary_outcome.measure: Compare the evaluation of the point light display on the detection and action recognition
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the program (3 weeks max)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentages of correct recognition of actions on the point light display

secondary_outcome.measure: Compare the evaluation of the point light display on the feeling of self-efficacy personal
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the program (3 weeks max)
secondary_outcome.description: Test score questionnary of self-efficacy personal (Dumont et al., 2000).

arm_group.description: Control group who will do usual rehabilitation.
Experimental group who will do usual rehabilitation and visualization of point-light human actions

intervention.description: Experimental group who will do usual rehabilitation and visualization of point-light human actions

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Volunteers over 18 years of age who have undergone knee surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any locomotor condition not due to knee surgery
- Uncorrected visual disturbances
- Comorbidity altering locomotion (history of stroke, neurological condition, inflammatory rheumatism)
